meanings.sent1: His hard work did not warrant a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The evidence presented in court did not warrant a guilty verdict.
meanings.sent3: The heavy rain did not warrant an umbrella, but he carried one anyway.
meanings.sent4: Her rude behavior did not warrant forgiveness.
meanings.sent5: The small scratch on the car did not warrant such a big repair bill.

meanings.sent1: The manufacturer's warranty will warrant the quality of the product.
meanings.sent2: A good reputation can warrant trust from customers.
meanings.sent3: His confident smile seemed to warrant success in the interview.
meanings.sent4: The loud applause will warrant an encore performance.
meanings.sent5: The clear instructions will warrant a successful outcome.

meanings.sent1: He needed a warrant to enter the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's signature on the form serves as a warrant for participation.
meanings.sent3: The golden ticket was his warrant to enter the exclusive event.
meanings.sent4: The official stamp acts as a warrant for the document's validity.
meanings.sent5: The permit granted by the city council is a warrant for construction.

meanings.definition: Legal document authorizing an action or arrest
meanings.sent1: The police officer obtained a warrant before making the arrest.
meanings.sent2: The judge signed the warrant for the search of the suspect's property.
meanings.sent3: The detective carefully reviewed the warrant before proceeding with the investigation.
meanings.sent4: The warrant issued by the court allowed the seizure of the illegal goods.
meanings.sent5: The warrant specified the exact location to be searched by the authorities.
